title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, interest fostering open welcoming community, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery Personal attacks Trolling insulting/derogatory comments Public private harassment Publishing ’s private information, physical electronic addresses, without explicit permission unethical unprofessional conduct Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. adopting Code Conduct, project maintainers commit fairly consistently applying principles every aspect managing project. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct may permanently removed project team. Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project maintainer andy.teucher@gmail.com stephhazlitt@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated result response deemed necessary appropriate circumstances. Maintainers obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.3.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/3/0/

title: Get started with bcmaps
text: bcmaps R package spatial map layers British Columbia. bcmaps provides access various spatial layers British Columbia, administrative boundaries, natural resource management boundaries, watercourses, census boundaries, etc. layers available sf objects BC Albers projection, B.C. Government standard. layers accessed directly B.C. Data Catalogue using bcdata R package hood. See layer’s individual help file detail. IMPORTANT NOTE Support Spatial objects (sp) removed {bcmaps} v1.3.0. Please use sf objects {bcmaps}. discussion evolution spatial software stack R can found : https://r-spatial.org/r/2022/04/12/evolution.html.

title: Get started with bcmaps
text: see layers available, run available_layers() function: layers accessible shortcut function name object. can use data sf object. first time try access layer, prompted permission download layer hard drive. Subsequently layer available locally easy future access. example:  two British Columbia boundary map layers available bcmaps: bc_bound() fast plotting suitable detail figures (source: (7.5M) Provinces States - Atlas Canada Base Maps BC) bc_bound_hres() geospatial analyses requiring detailed lineworks British Columbia (source: Province British Columbia - Boundary Terrestrial)
code: library(bcmaps) available_layers() library(sf)  bc <- bc_bound() plot(st_geometry(bc))

title: Get started with bcmaps
text: default, layers returned sf spatial objects:
code: library(bcmaps) library(sf)  # Load and plot the boundaries of B.C.  bc <- bc_bound() plot(st_geometry(bc))  ## Next load the Regional Districts data, then extract and plot the Kootenays rd <- regional_districts() kootenays <- rd[rd$ADMIN_AREA_NAME == "Regional District of Central Kootenay", ] plot(st_geometry(kootenays), col = "lightseagreen", add = TRUE)

what: Digital Elevation Model for British Columbia 1:250,000
title: Get started with bcmaps
text: cded_raster cded_stars functions return 1:250,000 digital elevation model British Columbia bounded area interest. retrieving area bounded Logan Lake census subdivision:
code: library(raster)  aoi <- census_subdivision()[census_subdivision()$CENSUS_SUBDIVISION_NAME == "Logan Lake", ] aoi_raster <- cded_raster(aoi) plot(aoi_raster)

what: It’s a beautiful day in the neighbourhood
title: Get started with bcmaps
text: handy layer creating maps display bc_neighbours layer, accessible function name. example also illustrates using popular ggplot2 package plot maps R using geom_sf bc_cities() function available bcmaps:
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = bc_neighbours(), mapping = aes(fill = name)) +   geom_sf(data = bc_cities()) +   coord_sf(datum = NA) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(name = "Jurisdiction") +   theme_minimal()

title: Get started with bcmaps
text: version 0.15.0 B.C. BEC (Biogeoclimatic Ecosystem Classification) map available via bec() function, accompanying function bec_colours() function colour :
code: bec <- bec() library(ggplot2) bec_sub <- bec[bec$ZONE %in% c("BG", "PP"),] ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = bec_sub,           aes(fill = ZONE, col = ZONE)) +   scale_fill_manual(values = bec_colors()) +   scale_colour_manual(values = bec_colours())

title: Get started with bcmaps
text: first call layer function bcmaps remind layer last updated cache message. number reasons, might necessary get fresh layer bcmaps cache. easiest way update use force argument: Another option actively manage cache deleting old layer calling function :
code: ep <- ecoprovinces(force = TRUE) show_cached_files() delete_cache('ecoprovinces') ep <- ecoprovinces()

title: Get started with bcmaps
text: package also contains handy utility functions: transform_bc_albers() transforming sf object BC Albers projection bc_area() get total area British Columbia various units bc_bbox() get extend/bounding box British Columbia

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andy Teucher. Author, maintainer. Sam Albers. Author, contributor. Stephanie Hazlitt. Author, contributor. Province British Columbia. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Teucher , Albers S, Hazlitt S (2023). bcmaps: Map Layers Spatial Utilities British Columbia. https://github.com/bcgov/bcmaps, https://bcgov.github.io/bcmaps/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bcmaps: Map Layers and Spatial Utilities for British Columbia},   author = {Andy Teucher and Sam Albers and Stephanie Hazlitt},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/bcgov/bcmaps, https://bcgov.github.io/bcmaps/}, }

what: Map Layers and Spatial Utilities for British Columbia
title: Map Layers and Spatial Utilities for British Columbia
text: R package spatial map layers British Columbia. bcmaps provides access various spatial layers British Columbia, administrative boundaries, natural resource management boundaries, watercourses, census boundaries, etc. layers available sf objects BC Albers projection, B.C. Government standard. layers accessed directly B.C. Data Catalogue using bcdata R package hood. See layer’s individual help file detail. IMPORTANT NOTE Support Spatial objects (sp) removed {bcmaps} v1.3.0. Please use sf objects {bcmaps}. discussion evolution spatial software stack R can found : https://r-spatial.org/r/2022/04/12/evolution.html.

what: bcmaps: Map Layers and Spatial Utilities for British Columbia — bcmaps-package
title: bcmaps: Map Layers and Spatial Utilities for British Columbia — bcmaps-package
text: Various layers B.C., including administrative boundaries, natural resource management boundaries, census boundaries etc. layers available BC Albers (https://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/nad83-bc-albers/) equal-area projection, B.C. government standard. layers sourced British Columbia Canadian government open licenses, including B.C. Data Catalogue (https://data.gov.bc.ca), Government Canada Open Data Portal (https://open.canada.ca/en/using-open-data), Statistics Canada (https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/reference/licence).

title: Canadian Digital Elevation Model (CDED) — cded
text: Digital Elevation Model (DEM) British Columbia produced GeoBC. data TRIM DEM converted Canadian Digital Elevation Data (CDED) format. data consists ordered array ground reflective surface elevations, recorded metres, regularly spaced intervals. spacing grid points .75 arc seconds north/south. data converted 1:50,000 grids distribution. scale modified data 1:250,000 captured original source data scale 1:20,000.

title: Canadian Digital Elevation Model (CDED) — cded
code: cded(   aoi = NULL,   tiles_50K = NULL,   .predicate = sf::st_intersects,   dest_vrt = tempfile(fileext = ".vrt"),   ask = interactive(),   check_tiles = TRUE )

title: Canadian Digital Elevation Model (CDED) — cded
text: aoi Area Interest. Currently supports sf sp polygons, stars raster objects. tiles_50K character vector 1:50,000 NTS mapsheet tiles .predicate geometry predicate function used find mapsheets aoi. Default sf::st_intersects. dest_vrt location vrt file. Defaults temporary file, can overridden like save project ask function ask user downloading data cache? Defaults value interactive(). check_tiles tiles already cache checked see need updating? Default TRUE. running code frequently confident tiles changed, setting FALSE speed things .

and clip the raster to each polygon. Optionally done in parallel — raster_by_poly

title:
Overlay a SpatialPolygonsDataFrame or sf polygons layer on a raster layer
and clip the raster to each polygon. Optionally done in parallel — raster_by_poly
text: raster_layer raster layer poly SpatialPolygonsDataFrame layer sf layer poly_field field split SpatialPolygonsDataFrame summarize function summarise raster values polygon vector? Default FALSE parallel process parallel? Default FALSE. TRUE, user call future::plan() (set options) specify parallel strategy use.

what: Removal of sp and raster support
title: bcmaps 2.0.0
text: ’ve removed support sp raster packages, especially parts require use rgdal rgeos packages, retired October 2023. See r-spatial blog details evolution. Removed class argument data download functions: get_layer() wrapper shortcuts bc_bound(), census_tract(), etc. functions now return sf objects. Spatial method transform_bc_albers() removed. fix_geo_problems() removed. sf objects simply use sf::st_make_valid() self_union() removed. Use raster::union() SpatialPolygonsDataFrames, sf::st_union() sf objects instead. get_poly_attribute() removed. raster_by_poly() retained now rely rgdal rgeos, just sp raster, still maintained.

title: bcmaps 2.0.0
text: Added pkgdown site bcmaps https://bcgov.github.io/bcmaps/ (#63) Moved detailed user documentation README Get Started bcmaps article/vignette (#42) Better documentation bc_bound_hres() (#124)

title: bcmaps 1.2.0

what: Deprecation of sp and raster support
title: bcmaps 1.2.0
text: ’ve started process removing support sp raster packages, especially parts require use rgdal rgeos packages, retired October 2023. See r-spatial blog details evolution. fully remove support Spatial classes (package sp) next release Summer 2023. Added deprecation warnings class argument data download functions: get_layer() wrapper shortcuts bc_bound(), census_tract(), etc. argument removed next version bcmaps functions return sf objects. Spatial method transform_bc_albers() deprecated. fix_geo_problems() deprecated removed completely Summer 2023. sf objects simply use sf::st_make_valid() self_union() deprecated removed Summer 2023. Use raster::union() SpatialPolygonsDataFrames, sf::st_union() sf objects instead. get_poly_attribute() deprecated niche application calculating attributes SpatialPolygonsDataFrame, removing support . removed completely Summer 2023.

title: bcmaps 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-06 bec tsa layers now downloaded directly BC Data Catalogue. ensures --date means rely manual updating layers https://github.com/bcgov/bcmapsdata. (#62, #115) Package startup message longer needing bcmapsdata package removed.

title: bcmaps 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-26 New behaviour shortcut functions ensures spatial objects (sf Spatial) returned topologically valid standard CRS “EPSG:3005” (BC Albers). #96 robust behaviour getting checking cache cded files.

title: bcmaps 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-09 New helper function show_cached_files() show files cached (much space ’re taking computer). (#92, #93)

title: bcmaps 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-19 R version >= 4.0, bcmaps use tools::R_user_dir("bcmaps", "cache") determine cache directory, R version < 4.0, use rappdirs::user_cache_dir("bcmaps"). align CRAN’s storage policy using tools approach maintaining backwards compatibility older R versions. Unfortunately require users updated version 1.0 re-download layers caching layers different location file system version. Users wishing clear old cache location run bcmaps::delete_cache() updating bcmaps 1.0.1. (#83) cded_raster cded_stars directly accepts bounding box generated sf::st_bbox aoi. (#87) Fixed bug bundled datasets (e.g., mapsheets_50K(), mapsheets_250K()) work sf linked older GDAL/PROJ libraries due different formats coordinate reference systems. (#85) Added new census boundary layers: census_dissemination_area(), census_metropolitan_area(), census_tract() (#82). Add missing layers available_layers

title: bcmaps 1.0
text: Drop dependency {bcmapsdata} favour directly retrieving layers (present) B.C. Data Catalogue (via {bcdata}) storing local cache. additional layers retrieved Statistics Canada. layers may identical previously {bcmaps}. example bc_neighbours previously used data Natural Earth. availability Hi-Res B.C. boundaries WFS B.C. Data Catalogue means layer can now created directly {bcmaps}. Added forward sortation area (fsa), health boundaries (health_*) census boundaries (census_*). Added ability retrieve cache CDED (BC Digital Elevation Model data, returning either stars raster objects (#73) Use parallelism functions allow (raster_by_poly() & summarize_raster_list()) now reliant users setting future::plan() specify strategy number workers, rather setting defaults (best practice according author future package @HenrikBengtsson, #69) Fixed bug errors occur user’s system GEOS development version (e.g., 3.9.0dev; #71)

title: bcmaps 0.18.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-29 Fixed error fix_geo_problems() fail depending version GEOS upon sf built. raster_by_poly() fails informatively NA values column polygons split (#48, thanks @j-galloway) raster_by_poly() (summarize_raster_list()) now uses future.apply package parallelism, enabling easy parallelization across platforms (#49) get_layer() (turn, individual layer functions) now sets crs crs representation always date user’s sf version (#51, https://github.com/r-spatial/sf/issues/1225)

title: bcmaps 0.18.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-15 Added bc_neighbours() function call layers containing adjacent jurisdictions. Ensured geometry column layers consistently named "geometry" (Thanks @boshek) Moving sf package Depends take advantage sf print methods. Added bc_bbox() get bounding box British Columbia (#40). references external data package now point bcmapsdata R bug (https://bugs.r-project.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=17520)

title: bcmaps v0.17.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-14 Fixed issue self_union() fail due change raster package (30cef3438)

title: bcmaps 0.17.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-01-18 Output available_layers() changed: shortcut_function column now logical, uses better column names, custom print function gives information. (#34) Add links combine_nr_rd() function regional_districts() municipalities(). function combines Regional Districts Northern Rockies Regional Municipalities create full provincial layer ‘Regional-District-like’ polygons. Added Timber Supply Areas BC cities shortcut function available_layers() bec (large downloadable layers) show output available_layers(), bec() works, get_layer("bec") works getting downloadable datasets indistinguishable getting local datasets. (#32) utility functions use sf functions moved lwgeom package. now use lwgeom function (Fixes CRAN CHECK NOTE; #33). Added new layer: bc_cities() point layer B.C.’s major cities.

title: bcmaps 0.16.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-12-20 First release CRAN Added two new functions: raster_by_poly overlay SpatialPolygonsDataFrmae sf polygons layer raster layer clip raster polygon, summarize_raster_list summarize results raster_to_poly

title: bcmaps 0.15.1
text: get_layer() now accepts characters (#31) Fixes bug check_write_to_data_dir creating data directory Update README installation instructions vignettes aren’t built bcmaps.rdata installed (#29)

title: bcmaps 0.15.0
text: Added ability download Biogeoclimatic Zone map - big fit bcmaps.rdata package, hosted asset GitHub release bcmaps.rdata, downloaded via function bec(), uses new function get_big_data() (#28). Added function bec_colours() (alias bec_colors()) generate vector colours match standard colours used colour Biogeoclimatic Zone maps.

title: bcmaps 0.14.0
text: Changed lookup exported objected getNamespaceExports("bcmaps") can call layers without loading package via bcmaps:: Removed watersheds layer package Added ecosections package

title: bcmaps 0.13.0
text: major new release breaking changes. data removed bcmaps package moved bcmaps.rdata package, hosted bcgov drat repository: https://github.com/bcgov/drat. package must installed order bcmaps access data. can installed : install.packages('bcmaps.rdata', repos='https://bcgov.github.io/drat/') previous versions bcmaps, data stored package loaded calling data("layername") simply layername (e.g., data("bc_bound") bc_bound). Now loading data requires function call - either using shortcut function name dataset (e.g., bc_bound() whereas previously one simply use bc_bound). Alternatively, one can use get_layer() function (e.g., get_layer("bc_bound")). Another major change layers now returned sf classes default, rather Spatial classes. Spatial versions data can still obtained setting class argument "sp" get_layer() shortcut functions (E.g., bc_bound(class = "sp") get_layer("bc_bound", class = "sp")).

title: bcmaps 0.12.0
bcmaps 0.11.0
bcmaps 0.10.1
bcmaps 0.10.0

bcmaps 0.8.2
text: Added tries argument fix_geo_problems function set maximum number iterations go attempting repair topological issues.

title: bcmaps 0.8.1
text: Set character encoding watercourses_15M watercourses_5M datasets UTF-8.

title: bcmaps 0.8.0
bcmaps 0.7.1
text: fix_geo_problems transform_bc_albers Generic functions methods sf objects well Spatial objects fix_self_intersect now defunct

title: bcmaps 0.6.2
text: fix_self_intersect renamed fix_geo_problems (kept alias now) fix_geo_problems can often also fix orphaned holes addition self-intersections.

title: bcmaps 0.6.0
text: Added watersheds dataset (#15, @markjohnsonubc) Added NEWS.md file track changes package.

title: bcmaps 0.5.0
text: Added two new functions create work SpatailPolygonsDataFrames nested data frames: self_union performs union single SpatialPolygons* object take account overlaps. Polygon attributes combined nested dataframe. get_poly_attribute allows easily parse nested data frame column (created self_union) extract calculate attributes want

title: bcmaps 0.4.0
text: Added couple convenience functions: transform_bc_albers() transforms Spatial object BC Albers projection fix_self_intersect() checks repairs self-intersecting polygons

title: bcmaps 0.3.0
text: Added 3 Natural Resource layers (areas, regions districts)

title: bcmaps 0.2.0
bcmaps 0.1.0
